question.text: Select the wrong statement from the following.

options.text: Both chloroplasts and mitochondria have an internal compartment, bounded by the thylakoid membrane.
Both chloroplasts and mitochondria contain DNA.
The chloroplasts are generally much larger than mitochondria.
Both chloroplasts and mitochondria contain an inner and an outer membrane.

solution.text: Both chloroplasts and mitochondria contain DNA and are double membrane-bound organelles having an inner membrane and outer membrane. Mitochondria occur in the cytoplasm of both plants and animal cells. A mitochondrion contains two chambers. The inner membrane forms mitochondrial cristae. The chloroplast is also a double membranous organelle but found only in plants. The membrane-bound matrix of chloroplasts is stroma and inside the stroma thylakoids are present which form grana.
